title: Snow in metro Atlanta: Some 200 flights canceled, airport says
title_page: Snow in metro Atlanta: Some 200 flights canceled, airport says
text:
Some 200 flights at Hartsfield-Jackson International Airport have been canceled Tuesday amid snowy weather in Atlanta and some other parts of the country, an official told The Atlanta Journal-Constitution.
A wintry mix of sleet, rain and snow began falling across the northern suburbs around 4 a.m. Tuesday, while snow was reported across the mountain counties. Drivers are urged to check current traffic conditions before leaving home. Read the full story and forecast .
Additional coverage: De-icing pads open at Hartsfield-Jackson
